reviews.title: our "home" for 11 nights
reviews.text: We have wanted to visit Rome for years to see all the amazing ancient historic and religious sights all of which exceeded our expectations !

What we did not anticipate is that we would actually begin to feel like we were "living" there - the reasons for that were the proximity to the river, local churches, the cabs, and buses, fabulous little cafes and gelatos within 1 or 2 blocks in every direction, our beautiful comfortable 'historic but restored' ultra clean room and modern bath, the lobby computer and fridge filled with yogurt, juice, and limoncello.
reviews.title: Loveable B&B in the heart of Trastevere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, most importantly, Daniela and the owner Lorenza, who both did everything to make us feel at home during our entire stay, beginning with the email correspondence for the past year and sending a driver to pick us up at the airport ! Then, daily, asking if there is anything we needed to be comfortable or to know about the area !
reviews.title: So helpful

reviews.text: When we return to Rome, we shall definitely stay here again !!
reviews.title: A taste of Trastervere

likes.liked: — Clean, quiet, well situated for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lorenza's B&B is just so great. We absolutely loved it from the first second (could be because they managed to have a room perfume that is so nice). Our room (we stayed in a quadruple) was clean, full of charme and had a bathroom with everything you need for a pleasent stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location!!!!

likes.liked: — Location and the friendliness of Daniela and Lorenza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I can only support all of the other good reviews of this place.
reviews.title: A nice little Gem in Trastevere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend 7 nights around New Year and the staff was friendly, the room was nice and clean with a new bathroom, the area was quiet and away from the tourists.
reviews.title: An Absolutely Brilliant Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather during our stay was quite cold, but the lobby and room were well heated and we were always comfortable. The homemade limoncello in the fridge of the lobby were together with hot tea our bedtime enjoyment each day, a very nice feature. We made limoncello at home upon arrival instead of the terrible commercial ones.
reviews.title: Super base for a Rome visit with great amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay at the Arco del Lauro again when we are in Rome next time.
reviews.title: Great place for a short stay in Rome

reviews.text: Stayed at Arco del Lauro for 4 great nights & found everything perfect. Daniella's warm welcome set the scene for a truly comfortable stay in a Roman "home from home". Situated in lively Trastevere & perfectly placed for trams & buses to the tourist spots, we enjoyed peace & tranquility when we needed to rest but were right in amongst the action when we were looking for action.
reviews.title: Convenient and affordable -- the perfect non-touristy place to stay in Rome
Perfect location, great accomodation
reviews.text: We spent three days at Arco del Lauro in the quadruple room which had two single beds and a queen size bed. The accomodation was excellent - spacious, clean with new furniture. The bath was also very good. Breakfast was served at a cafe near the B&B and included a croissant of our choice and coffee/juice. They also had yogurt in the refrigerator at the B&B as well as instant coffee, tea and juice for our use at the B&B. Lorenza and Daniela were very helpful and hospitable. They gave us useful information about touring the city and also arranged for our taxi to the airport on the last day. The rates are very affordable and the area is very well connected to the public transportation system. We strongly recommend this place to anyone visiting Rome.

We booked our first few nights in Rome in this lovely b&b during August and loved it! There were 7 of us (all adults) occupying 2 doubles and 1 triple. It is very conveniently located in a quiet locale, surrounded by terrific eateries and just 15 minutes walk to the old centre (take the #8 tram to save you some walking). This place is terrific given the price.
reviews.title: Great little find in Rome

likes.liked: — Quietness, price and free internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had big windows to let the fresh air in, fantastic airconditioning and good shower pressure. Decoration was simple and bright; daily housekeeping kept it all beautifully clean. Daniela was a very nice and helpful host.
reviews.title: Little Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you ask Daniela to book you a taxi as Arco Del Lauro is in a small one-way street and taxi drivers will get lost. Also be aware that the bathrooms are tiny. I think ours was no more than 1.2m x 2.0m approx.
reviews.title: Well located, cheap and clean
Arco del Lauro, Trastevere.
reviews.text: We booked this B&B because we were on a very tight schedule in Rome (less than 24 hours - crazy I know!) but wanted to fit in some sightseeing and we were arriving in the evening. Reviews of other accommodation disclosed all sorts of problems with people not being able to find hotels, hotels being over-booked etc so booked this one principally because, from other reviews, the owners seemed very reliable. And it looked clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Arco del Lauro for 9 nights and found it to be the perfect choice. It was affordable, clean and extremely well located. We were able to walk absolutely everywhere from the forum to the vatican to the appain way and even the spanish steps. The rooms are plain but comfortable and the management is friendly and very helpful. We enjoyed the restaurant recommendations and particularly liked Spirito di Vino and Alle Fratte in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Perfectly situated to explore all of Rome!

likes.liked: — Location, helpful staff, well stocked/healthy snacks
likes.disliked: — Plain decore, small shower, heat only came on part of the time so it got a little chilly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can only support all of the other good reviews of this place:
reviews.title: Great place in Trastevere

reviews.text: - clean rooms
